channel.title: Need some gpus
channel.description:
Well can anyone list me some decent video cards that wont overheat like a bitch?
I'm talking about anywhere from 25-45c on idle and no more than 50-55c on full load
It's not for me but for my cousins, they need a new one and they mainly use it for school and a few games like cs 1.6 but not any major game like crysis.
So whats a good video card that will stay cool, run quiet and last awhile?
Edit: was thinking something along the lines of these
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814130395
Or a 9600?

item.title: Need some gpus
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:13, topic:300826”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=397101.msg2950593#msg2950593 date=1252471090]

[quote author=la­wl link=topic=397101.msg2950354#msg2950354 date=1252459562]

get gddr3 if you want to be more futureproof
[/quote]by the looks of things these days, gddr5 won’t even be futureproof

It’s $64.99 so if it lasts at least a year or so it’ll be ok

i got my 8800gs for $47, but it was a big sale. this thing should last me 5 years at least…
[/quote]unless you turn into a proper gamer

plz find me a game i cant play with it

running crysis @ low @ 800x600 @ 40fps isn’t really worth playing crysis in the first place. Thought u had 8600gs, eh u got some power but it’s not really going to last 5 years.

its already been a year or so, and i dont really care about the graphics as long as its playable. all the games i play right now (cnc3, css, gmod) run perfectly smooth on max settings so i think im ok

what resolution/monitor u gaming on?

1280x1024[/quote]explains it

Read full topic

what resolution/monitor u gaming on?[/quote]
1280x1024

I have no freaking idea what you are going on about. I run crysis at 1680x1050 on medium settings at 40 fps, and thats all I need. Besides that game isn’t that great anyway and it goes by quickly.

item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

Well can anyone list me some decent video cards that wont overheat like a bitch?

I’m talking about anywhere from 25-45c on idle and no more than 50-55c on full load

It’s not for me but for my cousins, they need a new one and they mainly use it for school and a few games like cs 1.6 but not any major game like crysis.

So whats a good video card that will stay cool, run quiet and last awhile?

Edit: was thinking something along the lines of these

newegg.com

EVGA GeForce 9500 GT DirectX 10 01G-P3-N959-TR 1GB 128-Bit DDR2 PCI Express 2.0...

Buy EVGA GeForce 9500 GT DirectX 10 01G-P3-N959-TR 1GB 128-Bit DDR2 PCI Express 2.0 x16 HDCP Ready SLI Support Video Card with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Or a 9600?
